meanings.definition: Speak badly of or tell lies about (someone) so as to damage their reputation.
meanings.sent1: She traduced her classmate by spreading false rumors about her.
meanings.sent2: The politician was traduced by his opponents during the election campaign.
meanings.sent3: The jealous girl traduced her rival in an attempt to make herself look better.
meanings.sent4: The tabloid traduced the celebrity with sensationalized stories.
meanings.sent5: His former friend traduced him out of spite, tarnishing his good name.

meanings.definition: To expose to shame or blame by means of falsehood and misrepresentation.
meanings.sent1: The bully traduced the new student in front of the whole class.
meanings.sent2: The malicious gossip traduced her coworker, causing tension in the office.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous parrot traduced its owner by repeating embarrassing secrets.
meanings.sent4: The fake news article traduced the company, leading to a drop in stock prices.
meanings.sent5: The vengeful ex-partner traduced him in public, ruining his reputation.
